intro: Alsodeia cauliflora, commonly known as the cauliflower dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelion blooms. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster, which are followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Alsodeia cauliflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
